content: bavarian fingerless mittens materials - 80 g höfer 2-fädige schafwolle dk- 100gr/225m i highly recommend this yarn - double-pointed needles 4 needles are okay 2 5 mm and 3 mm beginning using 2 5 mm needles - cast on 39 stitches i recommend dividing them onto 3 needles of 13 stitches each and knitting in the round with 4 needles instead of the usual 5 - knit 9 rounds - now work a folded hem fold the beginning inward and knit each stitch together with the corresponding thread from the cast-on row - purl 1 round - knit 1 round - purl 1 round - knit 1 round patterned part work according to chart 1 on the next page all knit stitches are twisted after finishing round 39 place stitches 1-42 on holders place stitches 43-58 on your double pointed needles thumb continuing after stitch 58 cast on 5 additional stitches and close to round you have 21 stitches on your needles follow chart 2 when you start round 5 change to smaller needles after finishing round 5 continue like this - purl 1 round - knit 1 round - purl 1 round - knit 9 rounds bind off the stitches loosely knitwise cut yarn leave a 20 cm thread 1/5 palm place the stitches from the holders back to the bigger needles pick up 5 stitches from the thumb close to round and begin chart 3 at round 16 change to smaller needles - purl 1 round - knit 1 round - purl 1 round - knit 9 rounds bind off the stitches loosely knitwise cut yarn leave a 40 cm thread now fold the hems and sew the cast-off edges to the corresponding stitches of the first of the 9 knitting rounds work the second mitten the same way if you appreciate this pattern and would like to pay me for it i would be delighted if you download another paid pattern from my ravelry store if you d like to send me sats just contact me phazelia@yahoo de enjoy the pattern 2/5
